summary: This is the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York daily lieutenant's log for the morning watch shift on August 10, 2019. It chronologically records routine operations and counts, culminating in the medical emergency for inmate Jeffrey Epstein (Reg #76318-054), who was found unresponsive in his cell at 6:33 AM. CPR was performed, and he was transported to a local hospital by EMS.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Inmate (Reg #76318-054) found unresponsive in cell Z06-220 in Unit 9 South at 6:33 AM; CPR performed and transported to local hospital via EMS.

persons.name: Fernandez
persons.context: Inmate (Reg #86824-054) noted as being in a dry cell in the SHU (Special Housing Unit) at 12:35 AM.

events.title: Epstein Found Unresponsive in Cell
events.description: At 6:33 AM, a medical emergency was announced for inmate Jeffrey Epstein (Reg #76318-054) found unresponsive in cell Z06-220 in Unit 9 South. CPR was initiated by facility staff.

events.title: Epstein Transported to Hospital
events.description: EMS arrived at 6:43 AM and continued CPR. At 7:10 AM, EMS and BOP staff departed with inmate Epstein via ambulance to a local hospital, with CPR still in progress.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, NY
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein (Reg #76318-054) was found unresponsive in his cell (Z06-220, Unit 9 South) at 6:33 AM on August 10, 2019.
CPR was performed on Epstein by facility staff and continued by EMS personnel upon their arrival at 6:43 AM.
Epstein was transported via ambulance to a local hospital at 7:10 AM, with CPR still ongoing.
The log records routine overnight operations and inmate counts prior to the medical emergency.
Another inmate, Fernandez (Reg #86824-054), was noted as being held in a dry cell in the SHU.
